data.title: Microsoft raises dividend by about 10%
data.text: Microsoft Corp. MSFT, +1.64% announced it will raise its dividend about 10% Tuesday, to 56 cents a share from 51 cents a share.

data.title: Microsoft announces quarterly dividend increase
data.text: REDMOND, Wash., Sept. 15, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- Microsoft Corp. on Tuesday announced that its board of directors declared a quarterly dividend of $0.56 per share, reflecting a five cent or 10% increase over the previous quarter's dividend.

data.title: 5 Tech Stocks to Buy That Are Much Better Than FAANG
data.text: The "SUMBA" companies show even more promise than FAANG stocks for those seeking the best tech stocks to buy for 2021.

data.title: Microsoft Xbox Cloud Gaming Launches Today With More than 150 Games
data.text: The old xCloud is being rolled into the new cloud-based game streaming service.

data.title: Better Buy: Slack Technologies vs. Microsoft
data.text: Can the unprofitable enterprise communications company compete against one of the world's largest tech companies?

data.title: Microsoft (MSFT) Keen on Building Subsea Data Center Network
data.text: Microsoft (MSFT) is exploring the feasibility of underwater data centers as it remains committed to reducing its carbon footprint.

data.title: Microsoft's 'Netflix for video games' service launches, but you can't get it on iPhone
data.text: Microsoft's new game streaming service called xCloud is now available on Android phones.

data.title: Top CEOs Have Jettisoned a Boatload of Stock This Summer
data.text: I see very few chief executives stepping up to buy their own stock this summer, but I see scads of sellers.

data.title: There’s No Need to Pull the Trigger on Microsoft Stock Just Yet
data.text: The longer term outlook of MSFT stock is bright. But in the near-term, the tech pullback and other risks are likely to pull down the shares.

data.title: bp and Microsoft form strategic partnership to drive digital energy innovation and advance net zero goals
data.text: LONDON and REDMOND, Wash., Sept. 15, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- bp and Microsoft Corp.
